Quick Facts

EXIT   X

COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT MEASURES

Page

Table of Contents

 

 

A company or individual can be prosecuted for breaching WHS laws by the regulator; an inspector with written authorisation from the regulator; the Director of Public Prosecutions; or, in some states, unions.

 

If a court finds an individual or company guilty, they can make one or more of the following three orders in addition to any fine, imprisonment or other penalty.

 

Click the buttons below for more information

 

 

The court may order an offender, within a specified time limit, to:

 

•

publicise the offence, its consequences, the penalty and any other matter specified by the order

•

notify a specified person (or class of persons) about the offence, its consequences, the penalty and any other matter specified by the order

 

 

The court may order an offender, or arrange for one or more workers, to undertake specific training.

 

 

The court may order an offender to take certain steps specified in the order to remedy any consequences of the offence that the court considers the offender is able to remedy.
